aic2023.user

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • aic2023.user.Location

  • public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents the location of each of the tiles. The x-coordinate increases to the east (to the right at the screen), while the y-coordinate increases to the north (upwards at the screen). In order leak the least possible amount of information about the limits of the map, the bottom-left position of the map is set at a default value (x,y), which depends on the map, and all other locations are numbered accordingly (i.e. its adjacent location to the right would be (x+1, y)). The value of x and y is guaranteed to be between 0 and 1000.

      • add

        public Location add(Direction dir)
        Returns the location after moving from the current location following a given direction. There is a penalty for giving a null direction. It costs 2 energy.
        Parameters:
        dir - Given direction
        Returns:
        the location after moving from the current location following a given direction

      • add

      • directionTo

        public Direction directionTo(Location loc)
        Returns the direction that gets the closest to a given location. There is a penalty if the given location is null. It costs 5 energy.
        Parameters:
        loc - Given location.
        Returns:
        the direction that gets the closest to a given location.

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(Location loc)
        Returns if the given location is equal to this (in value). It costs 1 energy.
        Parameters:
        loc - Given location
        Returns:
        true if and only if both locations have equal coordinates.
